name: Floe Hag
movement: walk 30 ft., climb 20 ft., swim 40 ft.
description: The Floe Hag is a cunning fey with a strong presence, adaptable to both land and aquatic environments, showcasing notable physical prowess.
memorable: Its ability to manipulate opponents through psychic damage and its capability to store enemies in an extradimensional pocket make it a unique challenge.
goals: To manipulate and control, using its abilities to destabilize foes and gain the upper hand in confrontations.
relations: Often encountered alongside other hags or fey creatures, and may serve as a master to aquatic monsters.
environment: Cold, icy terrains and aquatic environments.
strengths: Immunity to cold damage, amphibious capabilities, and versatile spellcasting.
weaknesses: Average passive perception of 11 and relatively no specific awareness beyond its natural abilities.
attacks: The Floe Hag can perform dual claw attacks dealing both slashing and cold damage, or it can unleash ice bolts from a distance, causing severe cold effects.
most_powerful_ability: Distracting Knock allows the hag to incapacitate multiple foes, turning the tide of battle.
equipment: Parka that can store creatures in an extradimensional pocket.
senses: Passive perception of 11 is average, lacking any particularly acute senses.
skills: It displays average capabilities in perception.
additional_information: Can move across icy surfaces without penalties.
Can breathe both air and water, giving it versatility.
Utilizes strategic options in combat with multiattack capabilities.
Has both offensive spells and useful at-will spells.
Good physical stats make it a formidable foe in melee.
spellcasting: Can cast spells like fog cloud and sleep, in addition to at-will minor illusion and prestidigitation.
test_queries: hag that can swim and control cold
cold damage immune creature with extradimensional storage
ice-walking monster that uses psychic attacks
Floe Hag tactics in icy environments
